“The love and attention we seek is actually within.”

Most nights, I spend time thinking about how I am not loved by my friends the way I wanted to be loved. I long for the same things I do for them - random text messages, small piece of chocolates, or even just a five-minute talk about our lives. I always go to the loop of how I always initiate, I always give, I always care for and how the acts of love I give isn’t the same with what I get. Today, I realized I can do the things I do for others, for myself. I can spend time with just hanging around, listening to music, drawing and writing, buying my favorite candy, and giving myself the kind words I always seek from others.

I remember a quote I come across, non-verbatim but it sounded like “Talk to yourself as if you were your hurting friend.” If we can’t receive it from others, might as well give it to ourselves. No one is going to love us more than ourselves because we know ourselves inside out. It’s time to care for ourselves, too. 🤍

Day 25:

You know, I wasn't going to practice today.

I've gotten kinder and more understanding with myself when I miss days, and I've been pretty consistent for the past several. I woke up stiff all over, and managed to stretch a terrible crick into my back and shoulder, rather than out of it. Rounding my back twinged like a bad neck from sleeping upright in a chair. A few experimental cat-cows, just to try and loosen it up, _hurt_.

But it was the kind of hurt that felt like stretching and loosening up would help instead of make it worse, and I'm better at listening to my body now than I was a month ago, and I could tell the difference. And I did a bit of stretching, and the easiest thing seemed to be to go for some of the stretches we've done together in practice, some of the things I'd learned from Adriene, because after all, I know them now, right? And then five or ten minutes later, after I'd decided to skip today entirely, I was in tabletop position moving into a twist and I thought to myself, you know, if we're down here already anyway, we might as well at least see what the day's practice is.

And there it was, exactly what I needed. For my body, which hurts more than I wish it did at my age, and can't bend or lift or move the way I want it to, but which does bend and lift and feel and work as hard as it can, which has always done its best for me while I've tried to do my best for myself. For my heart.

Today was a good day.
